question: To a biologist, flowers are morphological and ______ marvels.
Flowers are the sites of ______ reproduction.
In earlier classes, you have read the various parts of a ______.
Figure 1.1 will help you recall the parts of a ______ flower.
Name the two parts in a flower in which the two most important units of sexual reproduction ______.
Much before the actual flower is seen on a plant, the decision that the plant is going to ______ has taken place.
Several hormonal and structural changes are initiated which lead to the differentiation and further development of the floral ______.
Inflorescences are formed which bear the floral buds and then the ______.
In the flower the male and female reproductive structures, the ______ and the gynoecium differentiate and develop.
The androecium consists of a whorl of ______ representing the male reproductive organ.
The androecium represents the ______ reproductive organ.
The gynoecium represents the ______ reproductive organ.
Flowers are morphological and embryological ______.
The sites of sexual reproduction in plants are the ______.
In earlier classes you have read the various ______ of a flower.
The floral primordium undergoes differentiation and further ______.
Inflorescences bear the floral buds and then the fully formed ______.
The male and female reproductive structures in flowers are androecium and ______.
The androecium consists of a whorl of stamens representing the ______ reproductive organ.
The gynoecium represents the ______ reproductive organ of the flower.
Much before the flower is seen, the decision to flower has already been ______.
Several hormonal and structural changes lead to formation of the floral ______.
Inflorescences are formed which bear ______ buds.
The androecium differentiates and develops into a whorl of ______.
The gynoecium differentiates and develops into the ______ reproductive organ.
Flowers are both morphological and ______ marvels.
The floral buds later develop into ______.
Androecium is the male reproductive organ while gynoecium is the ______ reproductive organ.
Much before a flower appears, hormonal and structural ______ are initiated.
The androecium consists of a ______ of stamens.
The gynoecium represents the female reproductive ______.
